title: Rotational KE - 2 cylinders up the same ramp

content.prompt: A hollow cylinder and uniform solid cylinder of the same mass and radius roll along a horizontal surface. The hollow cylinder and solid cylinder both roll up a ramp and momentarily come to rest at vertical heights hH and hS, respectively, above the horizontal surface. Both cylinders roll without slipping at all times. If the cylinders had the same initial linear speeds at the bottom of the ramp, which of the following correctly compares hH to hS and provides reasoning to support the comparison?

choices.label: hH>hS. The hollow cylinder had more mechanical energy at the bottom of the ramp than the solid cylinder.
hH>hS. The force of gravity exerted on the hollow cylinder is less than the force of gravity exerted on the solid cylinder.
hS>hH. The solid cylinder had more mechanical energy at the bottom of the ramp than the hollow cylinder.
hS>hH. The force of gravity exerted on the solid cylinder is less than the force of gravity exerted on the hollow cylinder.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
